TutorialScript.TutorialStep: It's Wednesday of prom week, and Oswald's cruising the halls like a wasp with a chip on its shoulder. Somebody's going to get stung.

Perhaps it'll be perennial target Lucas. The emos are so easy to pick on, for their fashion sense alone, and Oswald always enjoys the simple pleasures of feeling better about himself at the expense of another person.
...But something about the finality of prom week makes Oswald a little uneasy. Nobody's going to try to teach him a *lesson* or anything like that, are they?
Better to stay with a familiar target like Nicholas. He and Oswald have been on-again off-again frenemies since grade school.
While some say they have a lot in common (please!) Oswald knows who the better man really is. Maybe it's time to prove it once and for all.

And then there's the matter of finding a date. Oh dear me no, not Nicholas's dreary girlfriend Kate. While it would be funny to break them up, Oswald's definitely looking for someone with better hair.
...no! Oswald wasn't stopping here, his gaze was just passing around the room. Moving on...

...ah yes, Cassandra. She and Oswald have a shaky past, but there's a chance he could convince her to be his prom date. (True, she's dating his friend Buzz, but so are a lot of people, so it shouldn't be much of a stumbling block.)
But oh, the inanity! Oswald's not sure he'd be able to put up with Cassandra's 'conversation' for a whole night.
Well! Best get started. Prom night's not going to engineer itself.
